alert.note: Alert for Bottineau; McHenry; Pierce; Renville; Rolette; Ward (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 25 at 8:48AM CST until December 27 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 8 inches possible. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of north central North Dakota, including areas along and north of Highway 2. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...For Sunday afternoon through Monday morning, roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For today, a narrow band of heavier snow may produce localized amounts as high as 6 to 8 inches, between Interstate 94 to the South Dakota Border.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
